review_title: Hope all you care about is this job
pros:
Ed is a very kind and friendly manager. It's a close knit environment so you really feel like you are part of team (albeit a strict one)

There is a lot of practical experience to be gained working there as an engineer. You will oversee everything: from design, to production, to final delivery of products.
cons:
As an engineer you feel more like an hourly wage worker than a white collar professional. Good luck working from home without a good excuse like having COVID-19. In a world where white collar is becoming more associated with hybrid scheduling, this place feels a bit stuck in a bygone era. 

Leadership is almost non existent. These people are looking for a boy scout that will jump around constantly looking for stuff to do. Assignments are given to you over a 5 minute convo with zero presentation. Just a "hey I need this ...." 

If you like that kind of way of doing things you'll fit right in, but don't expect to be given timelines or schedules for deliverables. You'll only be notified of such things when it's already too late. Talk to your Production Controller if you want any kind of big picture for the job. As far as career growth this is definitely a good place to get hands on experience, but not stay long term, in my opinion. There is just not good work life balance. The senior engineers are constantly swamped. They consistently show up around 7:30 (or earlier) and stay past 6:00pm (or later). Presumably they like their jobs but if I'm going to be sacrificing that much of my personal time, I better be getting paid well; and this is the type of place where you have to show that level of dedication before you are paid anywhere near an appropriate level.

The instrumenation is over engineered for what is essentially an extremely busy stat lab. You will spend three hours a day running QC on these huge machines only to run about 50 to 100 samples per shift. When Bon Secour merged with Mercy they took away a full time med tech position, leaving one poor soul to run all of blood bank alone. Scary mistakes waiting to happen. Very high employee turn over , poor training opportunity because of the stressful nickle-and-dime workflow. Management is sympathetic but not very effective in making any positive changes.

The nurse to patient ratio is horrible. On an acute med surf floor you can expect to have up to 8 patients per nurse at times. They are also starting and expanding an old school “team nursing” care model which they are telling people is new and will be the best thing ever. It is an excuse to give an even higher ratio of patients to the nurses and to bring in LON’s so they can “increase productivity” and “balance the budget” Middle management doesn’t really have any power to help the floor and are pretty much told what to do so going to your manager doesn’t help. Patients are suffering and not getting adequate care. I am leaving this place as soon as my contract is up. The hospital is also dirty because they run with bare bones staff for all positions... not just nurses. For them it is all about the dollar. Then they act like they are Christian.

review_title: Awesome Place to Work - Highly Recommend!!
pros: This employer offers an engaged environment and the focus is not only on top notch patient care, but employees are valued and encouraged to grow and learn.  The benefits are fantastic!  Multiple healthcare plans offered and you can easily earn an extra $900 in wellness incentives to put towards medical expenses like Rx, Co-Pays, eye exams, dental visits, etc.  I used the tuition reimbursement as well and this benefit is available from day 1.  They completely paid for my MBA - huge benefit!  My managers have always been so encouraging of me trying new things and taking on new projects to continue to expand within my team.  I have had six promotions in the past seven years. Would recommend Bon Secours over and over again to any and all friends interested in healthcare!
cons: With such a large organization sometimes it is difficult to know people in other departments, but this is not too bad since I can always find someone to help me.

job_title: Desktop Support Analyst II in Greenville, SC
pros: Great work to life balance.  Mon-Fri 8-5pm.  Great pay and my personal management was top notch, professional, and kind.  All the tools needed to perform my job.
cons: Many decisions are being made at enterprise level limiting local market, they don't listen to what we actually need and make decisions that are best for the company, removing ability to adjust things in local market and also bonuses and raises were delayed because of not meeting goals, yet the ceo and upper management take trips to Europe.  I was also hired one day after cutoff date which resulted in me not getting a raise or bonus the first year.  This was a gray area that I asked about before being hired, I felt they pulled a fast one on me.  Keep in mind it was a decision made at corporate level, not local.  If it was local, my manager was top notch, and I trusted the individual with my career path.

job_title: Insurance Verification and Pre-registration in Richmond, VA
pros: As a company Bon Secours legitimately cares for their employees. With different wellness programs, outstanding benefits, and exceptional pay. It is a company that I believe anyone can feel comfortable in and grow if they come in and desire to grow.
cons: The company is going through many changes since they recently merged with Mercy Health System. Although salary and benefits are not changing at this time there is a lot of uncertainty within the company as to what will change and what stays the same. This has caused many long time employees to jump ship. In my specific position there is a ton of turnover, which leads to many feeling overworked and under appreciated. The financial department seems to be the entry way for many that want a job with this organization and after about 6 months they are off to a new area. So be prepared for many changes and turnover if you are coming into the organization at this time.

review_title: Twenty Year Employee of Bon Secours Health System
pros: Getting hired at Bon Secours was one of the best things that ever happened in my life. Before then, I struggled with the people at previous jobs, never really liking who I worked with. When I started at Bon Secours, it immediately was like I was working with family, and there were so many caring people around, caring for each other, the patients, and even their families. It really is a different world from other companies, unless you work for a good church or charity organization.
cons: The biggest downside that I've seen is that sometimes the quality of management is not there. That can be both a pro and a con, depending on if you are trying to get to a management position, or if you are being managed by that person who might not be the best fit. We use Gallup surveys to rate the organization, but there are not any tools to rate your direct supervisor(s) and I think there should be.

review_title: RN ST Francis Downtown Greenville, SC
pros: Nothing comes to mind.  Not the best place for new nurses to start.   Mean staff, short staffed, too much gossip
cons:
Do not orient new staff long enough- as a new grad you get about 5 weeks training (some of these spent working as a Nursing assistant due to short staff) supposed to have 12 - 
Nurse patient ratio is ridiculous, dont get to spend hardly any time with each patient and provide proper care
Staff are cruel to new nurses- get annoyed with questions, older nurses talk bad about you every time you turn around and treat you like an idiot
Not as patient focused as I thought- used to be that everyone I asked had something good to say about an experience at st francis...nowadays hear only negative things 
Short staffed- constantly having to work as nursing assistant d/t shortages- staff also call in sick regularly whenever they want its like if you dont feel like working one day, just call in sick no biggie

job_title: Human Resources Service Advisor in Richmond, VA
pros: New Facility. Love the gym next door. Employee engagements are fun. The pay is good for a call center
cons: Training is not consistent. Also, team leaders should be on the phones just as well as everyone else to help the volume of calls also, there were only certain teammates who were getting picked on constantly. One of the team leads were late and never got reprimanded for it.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Newport News, VA
pros: It's sad when you can't even find one positive thing to say about a place where you work...
cons: The staff are overworked and underpaid. Everything is about patient satisfaction and making money at the expense of the staff. Even with six-seven patients administration expects miracles and patients to be happy when you absolutely cannot tend to every patient in a timely manner with those nurse to patient ratios. Administration is clueless and managers are vindictive. I thought working for a catholic organization would mean people would have hearts and compassion, NOPE! God forbid an employee is sick or going through troubled times. You may as well talk to an empty wall because they do not want to hear it. You never hear anything positive about your work only the negative. Morale is at an all time low and staff is miserable, but who cares as long as patients are happy and the hospital is making money.

job_title: RN Wound Care in Norfolk, VA
pros: Great team work in my department. Wonderful manager who pitches in ALL the time to make sure that patients get proper treatment. Compared to my previous employer in this area, Bon Secours in general makes me feel like I am valued for more than just a warm body. Wellness incentives and facilities inside the hospital meant to promote wellness are available to EVERY employee.
cons: Approval for training and other expenses that were agreed to be covered moves at a snail's pace. Disconnected "higher ups" are making decisions that should involve the staff that are going to be affected by the decision.

pros: The pay is excellent when taking into account productivity bonuses. Benefits are consistent with other big industry players. PTO is generous
cons:
Little admin support. Insane workloads. Forty million online modules to complete every quarter to keep someone in HR happy. 
Providers can sometimes feel like widget makers on an assembly line. If you don’t keep up the numbers, they either fire you or make your life miserable. Luckily I had strong productivity numbers but I still got burned out after 9 years (4 with private practice, 5 as Bon Secours employee after we were bought out).

review_title: A horrible place for new grad nurses....very unethical and immoral operating under religious hypocrisy....
pros: Some of the people I worked with
cons: All units are very cliquish....if you don't believe as they do they will find a way to get rid of you. Bullying is rampant within this organization and nurses are treated like crap, if your a CNA or tech your treated even worse. They are always dangerously understaffed so that the hospital can make a profit. Physicians are treated like Gods and can do whatever they want to whomever they want. I worked in ICU and the goal there was to actually get family member to sign DNRs so that if the patient crashed no life saving measures would need to be done....that means none of the fat ass older nurses would have to get up and do anything....reassuring isn't it. Stay away from this company unless you really like discrimination and being made to feel like garbage daily.

pros: Bon Secours provides a strong culture and mission.  The employees of the company have a strong work ethic and go above and beyond their job description duties to care for patients.  The organization develops a strong team culture and most people buy into it which allows for collaboration and participation by all levels.
cons: Senior management is sometimes unaware of the struggles that unattainable "stretch" goals have on the stress levels of department level staff and managers.  Constant hiring freezes puts additional pressure on the teams that are already stretched pretty thin.

review_title: Easy going atmosphere with a commitment to patient care as a ministry.
job_title: Patient Account Representative in Suffolk, VA
pros: The best thing about this job is your coworkers. You become like family and everyone helps out to get the job done.
cons: Upper management is stuck in the mud and are used to doing things the old fashioned way. They are very closed minded. They laid off the entire Central Billing Office and opened a new one in Greenville SC to save the co money. A lot of experience was sent out the door to train new people and pay them less.

pros: Faith-based organization with strong values. Multiple life-long employees, implying that it is a healthy company to work for long term.
cons: The values are pushed during hiring, but not consistently lived out on a daily basis. Management does not live out these values. Also, as a private health system they are not competitive with salaries as compared to the general area.

review_title: Excellent place for pediatric habilitative therapy, but terrible management
pros: There are very few places in Northern Virginia for pediatric therapy for children with disabilities. Chesapeake had ST, OT and PT therapy in one place, nice therapists and centric location, nice flexibility of schedule and room for improvement
cons: The director doesn't have the business experience which leads to a poor management, there are frequent changes in logistics,  the pay is below average, the company doesn't have the software tools necessary for the therapists and there are excessive reporting to be completed by the therapists that is unnecessary. Holidays change every year and there is no communication between the therapists and the admin staff.

review_title: After 10+ years it started OK and promising with patient-focus in mind, now it's all about money. . .it's a shame.
pros: The people at ground level are good at what they do, care for the patients and others, and genuinely try to do their best everyday.
cons: Management is not trustworthy, they say are not doing certain things yesterday, but end up doing those things they had just denied on the next day.  They are focused on making money and making more money, even at the expense of the employees/patients.

review_title: Management does not hold physicians to the company's values. Docs say and do what they want w/o fear!
pros: There are people who are truly there to serve. The company's mission and value statements are strong and meaningful, and when they are top of mind, great work happens.
cons: Everyone is not being held to the same standard from senior management down. Unfortunately, individuals that that are not being held accountable know all to well that they will not be dismissed.

pros: good coworkers makes it enjoyable and we love finding a reason to celebrate.  It is nice to be bonded with your coworkers so you work as a team.
cons: The pay is terrible and they are constantly trying to get you to do way more with much much less. The treatment from the higher ups is not good.  They don't care what the problems  are but prefer to keep their heads in the sand.

pros: Variety of shift 8, 10, and 12 hours
cons: Management does not care. One manager just cares about cutting cost, the other does nothing. She will not do anything to help out other employees and is slow to take action when needed. Equipment is always breaking. The main department has 4 rooms- 3 out of 4 of them you can barely fit a stretcher in. The one large room is constantly broken and you cannot do table top exams in there due to the equipment not having a plate. At one point all of our portables were broken and we had to have one brought in.

pros: Great Company with great benefits and is a faith based Catholic Health Care Organization that stays true to the mission.  Opportunities seem to be endless with Bon Secours and I am fortunate to work in this organization.
cons: Sometimes not an early adopter of emerging technologies and very structured to the point of it being a fault.  But overall they are awesome to work with.

review_title: Great work environment and friendly staff.
pros: There is education reimbursement. The pay is great considering the small town that I live in. Upper management actually listens to the employees and do what needs to be done to resolve issues.
cons: Immediate supervisors need to listen more to their employees. The hiring process could be done quicker. Training should be done differently. Every new employee should be given a training manual with everything they need to know about the job they are performing in it.

pros: Enjoyed working with most of the people on the team.
cons: VERY uptight!! Write people up for the smallest things. Leadership team is on some type of ego trip made up of wanna be RNs who can't even handle bedside ER nursing! Very judgmental with everyone on their team. They tout diversity on their team but that is absolutely untrue.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Richmond, VA
pros: The organization seemed committed to it’s values and they aligned with mine. Best practices; emphasis on ethics and integrity; above all provide exceptional patient care and a safe workplace.
cons: Manager appeared to be invested in maintaining the perception of the unit over the actual day to day function. Ones ability to fit in was favored over a desire to provide the best care and experience to all.

pros: Hospital position, good experience, hospital setting
cons: NOT flexible, working holidays without pay, poor middle management with no decision making capacity, regional leaders make all decisions and direct managers have no power.  Losing good social workers due to the poor management    No advancement opportunities.

review_title: After 15 years, was set up and terminated for standing up for myself after reporting bullying and retaliation in office
job_title: Customer Care Manager in Richmond, VA
pros: The general company is driven to provide good help to those in need. Overall intentions are good.
cons: Understaffed on units. Cliques between staff and upper level management. Bullying and retaliation are overlooked. Poor research before termination due to right to work state laws. Will not eat that they unjustly fired you as long as it wasn't a 'discrimination' breech.

review_title: Just not Happy with Growth or appreciation at Bon Secours St. Francis. Love the People I work with.
pros: Love the people I work with.
cons:
No room for growth.
Management insincerity.
Lack of communication.
Do not pay holiday pay for most holidays.
Treat nurses very differently than salaried employees.
Take advantage of Nursing staff as much as possible.
Do not live up to promises made on hire.

review_title: In the middle of a hostile takeover
pros: I have loved working for Bon Secours for nearly 20 years. The family feeling has been great. There have been ups and downs over the years and we have pulled together to make it work.
cons: In late 2018, Bon Secours "merged" with Mercy Health.  The reality is this has been a hostile takeover.  Word from administration is "trust the process." It's as though they enjoy keeping us like mushrooms  - in the dark and fed with manure.  Even prior to this administration has never been great about listening to the little people. While direct management might listen to you, the higher ups keep their hands tied.  Then, the higher ups will come down and hold a meeting so they can "listen" to you. In reality, they (specific example, Toni Ardabell) hijack the meeting and talk the entire time so that you cannot voice your complaints.

review_title: People culture is supportive, but corporate is disconnected from the staff.
job_title: Medical Laboratory Scientist in Mauldin, SC
pros: Co workers and supervisor cares about you. Health system culture is compassionate for the patient needs, and employee input, overall. Depending on the location, some areas develop a great working relationship between interacting departments.
cons: You're still a warm body to fill a scheduling hole. The unspoken message from the corporate level is, "cut costs, increase labor, do more with less." Not a lot of freedom to choose working hours that work with your life.

pros: Good education funding up to 5000 a year full time. Earned vacations is pooled in with sick time. Health insurance available to both part time and full time employees. Self scheduling in some departments. Extra hourly money for weekends and evenings.
cons: Continually  short staffed. Continual cutbacks in supplies. More demands on staff for clinically based and driven patient care, with less time and supplies to provide care necessary.

pros: Never have to worry about supplies, they really do want the best for the residents. Clean, patient centered care.
cons: Have been short staffed lately so you pull a lot of work, which can be a great thing if you want hours. Some residents have a long list of special accommodations and that can get to be a bit much, some people can be lazy and not want to work, like anywhere.

pros: The employees make you feel like you are a family. You will gain a lot of experience working there from seeing the different variety of people you will care for. They offer tuition reimbursement for employees who are going to school as long as the classes are work related.
cons: They are always busy and always short staffed. They usually staff with agency staff a lot. Some agency nurses are better than others.

review_title: Great Environment and Patient Centered Care
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: This facility believes in patient-centered care and is changing the culture of SNF from institutional to a home environment.  Patients always get what they need, supplies are available, and the corporation believes in a just wage for all its employees.  Excellent tuition reimbursement for full-time employees up to 5k a year, great health care benefits and employee perks.
cons: Staffing difficulties. With increased acuity of patients - staffing needs to be increased or reallocated.

review_title: Good place to work; but watch your back.
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Virginia Beach, VA
pros: Good benefits, great doctors.  Good place to learn new things.  You have the ability to move within the company.  I would go back if I was in the area.
cons: Politics and Drama within the offices can get out of hand.  Make sure you keep documentation of everything to do with your job. Can't trust that promotions will be fairly decided.

review_title: No one is steering the ship.
pros: No one will follow up with you or set any clear goals. Great place to work if you like to coast and hide in the cracks of mismanagement. The staff is great but there is a big gap in the management to employee relationship.
cons: Management is sleeping and or does not know what you do or how to do it. There are no systems in place for anything and the ones that are in place are violated by management so why would the employees care.

pros: Amazing Chain of Command, I have worked with this team since 2009 and they have allowed me to expand my skills in different areas of the hospital including ICU, OR & ED, Special Procedures Team.
cons: I cannot think of any CONs exept the loss of Senior Nurses r/t to changing in upper management

review_title: Bon Secours is a great company to work for and leadership is truly committed to fulfilling the mission.
pros: Great opportunities for early careerists. Excellent health and work life benefits. Strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Very strong leadership and collaborative decision making.
cons: Highly matrixed organizational structure sometimes leads to lack of clarity in roles and responsibilities. Also, local systems are not always aligned with corporate office. Geographic spread and differences in service line mixes sometimes create silos within the company.

pros:
Wonderful staff - truly treat each other with respect and as family.  Salary is comparable but not competitive. The clinical staff is knowledgeable and truly care for the patients.  They are succeeding in getting back to the mission of the Sisters in healing the community. 

The health system offers well-built and maintained low income housing, many training programs, family support, etc. Their Community Works are is top-notch.
cons:
The executive leaders lack leadership ability for all the training they are given.  HSO can't seem to understand that a person has to want to lead, but here they seem to be in it for the perks - and they do get a lot of them.  Luckily, there are a few that are good at what they do - but just a few.

Communication is nil. Again, the leadership training is only effective if falling on open ears and minds.  There is a meeting once a week about communication and yet it seems nothing leaves that meeting room.  Most of management doesn't understand protocols or even the need for them - they seem to do whatever they always did and don't work as a team.

The salary is okay.  But you earn your time off.  Sounds fair, right. Until you factor in that you are not given paid holidays, you earn them and all of them come out of that leave.  Not good for those low on the totem pole.

This hospital is in an old building with numerous problems.  I'm sure the government would shut them down if a surprise inspection were made.  Safety is an issue in many circumstances. From what I have been told most inspections are scheduled and they hide the numerous infractions temporarily.  It appears to staff that management doesn't seem to care.  I do expect that one day the crumbling garage (with no elevator)  is going to collapse and am betting their insurance won't cover all the cars that will be destroyed.  

There is no effort that I can see to raise money for improvements.  There re only two means of raising funds here that I'm aware of.  A golf tournament that I believe goes entirely to the Community programs which is fine.  But every year I'm asked to give part of my salary back to support the organization paying me. What!

review_title: I loved what I did but not who I worked for

Great mission

Loved working in a place where you can speak freely of God

Secret promotions

review_title: Depends on the dept you are in

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Newport News, VA
pros: I didn't work in the best department, but there is really a lot of growth at Bon Secours. Working for the right manager and with the right team and it's a great company. Just don't have any health issues and you'll be fine.
cons: No concept of life outside of work, unorganized, hostile work environment in department, not conducive if you have an emergency health issue arise needing surgery.

review_title: Throwing out nurses that have been there 20 years plus replacing with cheaper help
job_title: Staff Nurse in Port Jervis, NY
pros: None, Closed Pediatrics, maturnity, Nursing home running @ 70%, cutting corners and losing doctors. Google them an see
cons: Ungratful group of administrators that have no interest in community. Losing money because of bad management

pros: Based on the Gallop Poll survey results, nurses enjoy working at Bon Secour Maryview based on the last 2 years of the survey

Senior leadership is very poor. Always claiming to have "no idea that was happening" They have unrealistic goals and fail to see the true level of stress and level of workload placed on staff

Gallop Survey Scores do not match what is being stated by the nurses on the units and at the bedside which leads me to believe they are not accurate.

review_title: Wonderful experience for the most part --

cons: The department management where I started off in was a little inconsistent with their rules and allowances. Things we were told we could do when we first came aboard were rejected as we went along in the role. Pretty inconsistent...

review_title: Fired all nurses there over 25 years
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Port Jervis, NY
pros: Small town. that needs local care
cons:
Port Jervis
I worked there for 30+ years and fired 2 days after my anniversary, Excuse was to many call outs even though I had 30 days in sick bank and my mother got ill and I needed to help her. they have done this to over 2 dozen other long time employees so younger less expensive nurses took their places. They have closed maternity ward, outsourced ER unit and now controlled out of Virginia. Now they supposedly sold to Westchester Medical and are turning into same day surgery and cutting beds in half, Should no longer be called a Hospital

review_title: There are better places to work.
job_title: Identity and Access Management Specialist in Richmond, VA
pros: I enjoyed meeting new friends at this job and that is the best part of working there.
cons: This by far was one of the most unprofessional environments I have ever worked in.  From the employees to the Director it was really the wild wild west there.  The managers are very rude and don't speak to the employees or greet them in the morning when they come in.  Common courtesies are lacking here.

job_title: ClinDoc Applications Coordinator II in Richmond, VA

These  staff members always get the light assignment while the rest get the heavy load. Certain nurses also treat the techs so bad with their bullying  they  quit, leaving no tech, and the nurse has to do everything. Management knows this but refuses to take action.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Greenville, SC
pros: Work environment is very friendly and the coworkers feel like a family. I am cross-trained in many different areas and I love the opportunities I have to grow here. It's a very fast-paced environment with many patients of all walks of life.

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Greenville, SC

cons: Miserable, unfriendly co-workers, extremely fast paced to the point of disregarding needs of staff. Vacation time granted then (tried) to take away because "someone else needed it". 40 hours not guaranteed but sometimes OT is required.

review_title: It’s a girls club from top to bottom

pros: I have been please to work in four different positions within the company. The daycare was one of many reasons I have stayed 20+ years.

review_title: A great place to start a career!

job_title: Physician Billing Representative in Warwick, NY

pros: Good unit leadership on the floor

pros: Daycare staff, coworker support, too many patients put on the schedule with expectation that they all are added on regardless of the amount of staff

review_title: Lots of Chief's not enough Indians EVER

pros: Team player, self starter, motivationer, dedication, family oriented, determined,
